description: Acute freeze response triggered by sudden fear spike with low determination to act

prerequisites.failure_message: Requires fear with a spike plus high threat and very low control—tonic immobility rather than panic/terror.

actor_description: I go still. Not calm—caught. My breath thins and my muscles forget how to follow instructions. I’m aware of everything at once—the room, the sounds, the space behind me—but I can’t turn that awareness into movement. The only thing my body seems sure about is: don’t be noticed, don’t make a sound, don’t give the threat a reason.
description_text: {actor} stops moving like a switch flipped—posture locked, eyes fixed too wide, breathing reduced to small careful sips. They look present but unreachable, a prey-stillness that reads as instinct rather than choice.

alternate_descriptions.auditory: I hear the faintest sound of controlled breathing, like someone is trying to make their lungs quieter.
